Ikut Miss Supernational 2019, Jesica Fitriana Angkat Tema Batak
06 Nov 2019, 04:33 by Chitra Paramaesti, Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Puteri Indonesia Pariwisata 2019, Jesica Fitriana Martasari menjadi wakil Indonesia dalam kontes kecantikan dunia, Miss Supranational 2019. Kontes ini akan berlangsung pada 18 November hingga 6 Desember 2019 di Polandia. Perhelatan tersebut menjadi yang ketujuh kalinya Yayasan Puteri Indonesia mengirimkan delegasinya untuk menjajal kemampuannya di kancah internasional.
Jesica akan mengenakan lima busana yang dibuat oleh para perancang ternama Indonesia. Salah satu busana yang dikenakan adalah buatan Jember Carvanal Festival, yang mengangkat tema wanita Batak. "Bangga banget bisa jadi perempuan Batak, ini tantangan baru buat aku," ucapnya di Aula Sasono Wiwoho pada Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Busana yang didominasi oleh warna hitam dan ulos merah, terlihat elegan dengan payet-payet yang dijahit di bagian pinggang Jesica. Perancang Intan Ayundavira mengatakan proses pembuatannya memakan waktu tiga bulan.
Dalam proses pembuatan busana tersebut, ternyata sempat ada perombakan besar ketika busana tersebut hampir jadi. Ayu menjelaskan, hal tersebut lantaran permintaan dari panitia penyelenggara untuk tidak membuat busana yang terlalu megah.
"Kalau kami, segala aksesoris dan perlengakapan yang ada pasti dibawa pulang kembali. Tapi ternyata kalau peserta lain ada yang dibuang begitu saja di hotel dan itu jadi menyusahkan. Jadi tahun ini, mereka meminta untuk tidak membuat busana yang festive banget," tutur Ayu.
Busana yang diilhami dari kekayaan budaya Batak dan Danau Toba ini, diberi nama Boru Niraja, yang artinya putri seorang raja. Dalam perancangan busananya pun, Jesica terlihat seperti bak warior princess yang biasa tampil di film Hollywood.
Ayu menjelaskan, makna filosifis dari baju tersebut adalah ia ingin mengeluarkan aura kuat dari seorang wanita Batak. Menurut dia, seorang wanita Batak merupakan pekerja keras yang tetap feminin sekaligus menjadi ibu yang kuat di keluarganya.

Joining Miss Supernational 2019, Jesica Fitriana Raised the Batak Theme
06 Nov 2019, 04:33 by Chitra Paramaesti, Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Princess of Tourism Indonesia in 2019, Jesica Fitriana Martasari became Indonesia's representative in the world beauty contest, Miss Supranational 2019. The contest will take place from 18 November to 6 December 2019 in Poland. The event was the seventh time the Indonesian Women's Foundation sent a delegation to try out its capabilities on the international scene.
Jesica will wear five dresses made by renowned Indonesian designers. One of the clothes worn is made by Jember Carvanal Festival, which has the theme of Batak women. "I am very proud to be a Batak woman, this is a new challenge for me," he said in the Sasono Wiwoho Hall on Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Clothing that is dominated by black and red ulos, looks elegant with sequins sewn on the waist of Jesica. Designer Intan Ayundavira said the manufacturing process took three months.
In the process of making these clothes, it turns out there was a major overhaul when the clothes were almost ready. Ayu explained, this was due to a request from the organizing committee not to make clothes that were too grand.
"For us, all the accessories and equipment are taken back. But it turns out if there are other participants who are thrown away at the hotel and it becomes troublesome. So this year, they ask not to make a very festive dress," Ayu said.
Clothing inspired by the cultural wealth of the Batak and Lake Toba, was named Boru Niraja, which means the daughter of a king. In designing any outfit, Jesica looks like a warrior princess who usually appears in Hollywood films.
Ayu explained, the philosophical meaning of the clothes was that she wanted to bring out a strong aura from a Batak woman. According to him, a Batak woman is a hard worker who remains feminine while becoming a strong mother in her family.
